block.p: For the first time in the Internet's brief existence, more women than men are going online, according to a survey by Media Metrix and Jupiter Communications. During the first quarter of this year, 50.4 percent of Internet users were women, and there was a 125 percent increase in teenage girls online. The survey also found that women, unlike men, don't surf so much as find sites that help them save time or money, and return to them.
